item.title: Outside 82 Greencroft Gardens NW6 3JQ, 17th September
item.description:
The road was dug up about 6 months ago and have been abandoned. There is a large hole, surrounded by rubble. The barriers have now been thrown in by someone so it's unsafe. I have contacted Streetworks who investigated. They think the road was dug up by Thames Water but a Virgin Media duct was damaged and they have refused to allow the hole to be mended until someone pays for the repairs to the duct. This is absurd! The roadworks are abandoned and unsightly, with weeds growing inside the home. They take up a much needed parking space. Crucially the hole is DANGEROUS. This needs to be urgently repaired.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 84, Greencroft Gardens, South Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A tenant at 22 Inglesham Walk, London E9 5JS has been scene digging up green space, communal greenspace, public land outside 22 Inglesham Walk, London E9 5JS without any permission on authorization from Council.Tenant has been digging up the communal public lawn digging holes and planting trees and bushes and damaging the public lawn., 17th September
item.description:
Tenants digging up communal space public land grass lawn causing damaged to grass lawn. Residents have no right to be doing this without permission if someone could please look into this.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Inglesham Walk, Hackney, London

item.title: Dumped bin and rubbish, 17th September
item.description:
Hello, we live on 41 Peckham Road in the building where the Sainsbury's is located. Right next to the building was dumped a large bin container and lots of rubbish that does not belong to the residents in 41 Peckham Road. This bin has been there for three weeks now and we thought we should report this issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30-39, Peckham Road, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On pavement, 17th September
item.description:
Tree branch has fallen or has been cut down - unsure. It is covering a lot of the pavement so you have to walk on the road a lot more than usual to cross in this area. Its been here a couple of days and not been removed so I think it should be reported. There also appears to be a lime bike in the middle of the fallen branch
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Granary Street, King's Cross, London
Report on FixMyStreet
